Young Adults Forum

 


"The future of the country depends on the skill and the sincerity of the youth. Therefore, the necessary enthusiasm and encouragement must be generated among the youth. All my hopes are based on the students, the youth. They are very dear to me." 
~ Sathya Sai Baba, (Sathya Sai Speaks Vol.13, Ch 1,***)

With the immense grace of our Beloved Sathya Sai Baba, the World Young Adults Festival will be held in July 2022 in Prashanthi Nilayam. 

Read further:  http://www.sathyasai.org/events/wyaf


The Sathya Sai Young Adults Programme (SSYAP) has been established to encourage men and women, between the ages of 18 and 40, to lead purposeful lives serving their families,communities and countries by learning and practicing spiritual principles taught and established by the life, message and teachings of Sathya Sai Baba. Over 10,000 Young Adults are an integral part of the Sathya Sai International Organisation and are encouraged by their respective local Sathya Sai Organisation to participate in community service projects, devotional and musical programmes, humanitarian reliefs and educational - SSEHV activities. These activities allow Young Adults to give primary importance to holistic character development through personal transformation and selfless service. 

The Prashanti Council has established an International Young Adults Committee to coordinate and lead the activities of the SSYAP across the globe. This committee comprises of the International Young Adult Coordinator and 11 Zonal Young Adult  Coordinators. 

Following the resolutions of the Sathya Sai World Youth Festival in 2016, the SSIO has undertaken various sustainable initiatives through the formation of nine international Young Adults subcommittees. The following subcommittees -

  1. Serve the Planet
  2. Ocean of Music
  3. Sathya Sai Sadhana of Love
  4. InSAIghts
  5. Group 4 Sai Spiritual Education to YA Transition
  6. Sathya Sai International Leadership Programme for Young Adults
  7. Information Management and Analytics
  8. YA International Engagement
  9. YA Media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter) and Editorial

comprise of talented YAs from over 75 countries who lead and participate in a  number of initiatives including leadership training, composing devotional and values-based songs, spiritual study of Sathya Sai Baba’s teachings, environmental protection and public engagement. Additionally, support is also provided to Young Adults all around the world in confidently communicating the core teachings of Sathya Sai Baba and the work of the SSIO with their family, friends, colleagues and so forth. 

About the Sai Young Adults Wing of Mauritius

The National Young Adults Forum of Mauritius actively encourages and inspires around *** Young Adults of the country to progress on their spiritual journey whilst realising their inherent divinity and to support the wider activities of the major wings of SSIO at local and international levels. The National Young Adults Coordinator, Deputy National Young Adults Coordinator and the National Young Adults Advisor lead efforts to motivate and guide talented Sai Young Adults of the country to participate in various local initiatives falling under the framework of EduCare, MediCare and SocioCare. These activities include - Walk for Values, Devotional and values- based songs offering, SSEHV training, blood donations, visit to old-age homes, study circles, environmental retreats and clean ups amongst others.

SATHYA SAI INTERNATIONAL LEADERSHIP PROGRAMME FOR YOUNG ADULTS 

“I want you to be leaders to protect the world. Leaders like lions, self-reliant, courageous, majestic and just. Lion is the king of animals and I want you to be king among men” 
~ Sathya Sai Baba, Summer Showers, 1992

The Sathya Sai International Leadership Programme (SSILP) for Young Adults (YAs) was developed in 2014 to provide standardised leadership training  based on Sathya Sai Baba’s core teachings to Young Adults across the globe. The SSILP Programme covers both foundational knowledge and practical application in society. With guidance from senior members of the SSIO, YA leaders took the initiative to develop this programme to equip Young Adults with the necessary knowledge and skills to conduct ground breaking projects with love, compassion and a selfless attitude. The programme is thus enriched with years of experience of senior devotees, modern resources created for YAs, and most importantly, the eternal and universal teachings of Sathya Sai Baba. The goal of the SSILP is to develop future leaders who will not only disseminate Sathya Sai Baba’s message through rendering service to society, but also to lead a rejuvenation of human values throughout the globe.

Objectives of the SSILP Programme: 

  • To raise a generation of young adults who are exemplars of the teachings and philosophy of life as taught by Sathya Sai Baba.
  • To give young adults a range of interpersonal communication skills for forging good relations with all officers and members of the SSIO.
  • To equip young adults with the tools and techniques that will help them foster good values such as love, compassion, humility, and respect to elders; thereby creating a positive and loving environment at home, in the SSIO, and in their local communities.
  • To develop skills for planning and implementing successful projects.
  • To develop the capacity to lead, manage, and motivate volunteer team members.
  • To develop mentoring skills for grooming future Young Adult leaders for smooth transitions and continuity.
  • To acquire knowledge and develop skills to become ideal leaders.

The 2021 Sathya Sai International Leadership Programme for Young Adults (SSILP) is now open for enrolment!

All  Young Adult Advisors and Young Adults Coordinators serving in any leadership role in the SSIO are strongly encouraged to participate in the SSILP.

For further details about the Sathya Sai International Leadership Programme,  http://www.sathyasai.org/ya/ssilp

World Young Adults Festival 2022

The World Young Adults Festival will be held in July 2020 in Prashanthi Nilayam. The theme chosen for the much awaited WYAF22 is S.A.T.H.Y.A - Spiritually Awakening The Hearts of Young Adults. With the name of the theme also being the name of our Beloved Master, this event will unite Young Adults from across the globe to rejuvenate their spiritual practices to realise their inner divinity and at the same time to implement the divine teachings of Sathya Sai Baba during the journey of their self - transformation. 

The WYAF22 will feature inspiring addresses by Young Adult leaders and eminent guest speakers, panel discussions and interactive workshops/seminars, multi-media presentations, sharing of personal transformations, musical, dance and cultural performances, a global Sai Olympics and many other inspiring items. The aim of these various activities is to guide and enable Young Adults in making their lives an inspiring message of Sathya Sai Baba through their collective future actions. 

Vedas, being very dear to our Beloved Lord, will be an important component of the WYAF22. An online Veda training programme has also been launched on the auspicious day of Aradhana Mahotsavam, 24th April 2020 to allow Sai Young Adults to collectively learn vedic mantras and their sacred importance.

If you would like to get involved and require further information, please contact the National Young Adults Forum or  WYAF21@sathyasai.org.

Read further about the WYAF22 at http://www.sathyasai.org/events/wyaf
